roleset.name: hear, physically hear (not sense of hearing itself)
roleset.note: HEAR-V NOTES: Member of Vncls discover-84-1-1, see-30.1-1-1. Comparison with 'say'. (from hear.01-v)
HEARING-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Based on hear.01. Vn classes see-30.1-1-1 and discover-84-1-1. Framed by Katie. (from hearing.03-n)

roles.note: Speaker and utterance can be very hard to distinguish. In general,avoid using arg2 unless it's really obvious that the speaker isseparate from the utterance. (from hear.01-v)

example.name: sound and speaker merged
example.text: ``When the sell programs hit, you can hear the order printers start to go'' on the Big Board trading floor, says one specialist there.
example.arg: the order printers start to go'' on the Big Board trading floor

example.name: clear speaker
example.text: American Medical accepted the offer, meanwhile indicating it had heard from two other suitors.

example.name: speaker as utterance
example.text: It isn't every day that we hear a Violetta who can sing the first act's high-flying music with all the little notes perfectly pitched and neatly stitched together.
example.arg: a Violetta who can sing the first act's high-flying music with all the little notes perfectly pitched and neatly stitched together

example.name: ADV for attributive
example.text: The worst [0]-1 I heard *trace*-1 about our Student Union President where I went to University was him flying out first class on the Student Union dime and staying at some 4 star hotel .
example.arg: about our Student Union President where I went to University

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: This musicological study describes how many of Delius' traits were influenced by his hearing the music of the people of Florida and Danville.
example.arg: the music of the people of Florida and Danville

roleset.name: a session of a committe or jury
roleset.note: HEARING-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Slight comparison to 'try.02'. No Vn or Fn classes. Framed by Katie. Comparison to verb-reviewe.01. (from hearing.01-n)

example.name: Args 1 and 2, where Mr. Breeden is on trial
Arg 0
example.text: the hearings before the Judiciary Committee
